references.paper_title: Solving the multiple instance problem with axis-parallel rectangles
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of Multiple Instance Learning (MIL), introducing the basic framework and problem formulation.
This paper provides another foundational framework for MIL, further shaping its conceptual understanding and exploration.
This work introduced a crucial advancement in MIL by applying attention mechanisms to deep learning models, significantly improving performance.

references.paper_title: TransMIL: Transformer based correlated multiple instance learning for whole slide image classification
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on whole-slide image classification, a central application within histopathology, and the use of transformers.

references.paper_title: Data-efficient and weakly supervised computational pathology on whole-slide images
references.reason: This research emphasizes the efficiency and weak supervision aspects of MIL in histopathology, highlighting its practical significance in resource-constrained settings.
